required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Performance of Air-Q Self Pressurized Airway Device With Blocker and I-Gel at Different Head and Neck Positions in Anesthetized Paralyzed Adult Female Patients Undergoing Elective Surgeries

brief_summary.textblock: Airo-Q Self Pressurized airway device with Blocker will be compared with I-Gel in anesthetized adult female patients undergoing elective surgeries to discuss the influence of different head and neck positions on the performance of both devices. Oropharyngeal leak pressure, peak inspiratory pressure, ventilation score and fiber-optic view will be assessed in neutral, flexion, extension and lateral positions in both groups.

primary_outcome.description: pressure at which air leak starts to occur

arm_group.arm_group_label: Air-Q Self Pressurized Airway Device with Blocker

intervention.intervention_name: Air-Q Self Pressurized Airway Device with Blocker
intervention.description: used in low risk adult females undergoing elective surgeries
intervention.arm_group_label: Air-Q Self Pressurized Airway Device with Blocker

intervention.description: used in low risk adult female patients undergoing elective surgeries

study_pop.textblock: Adult female patients who will be admitted through outpatient clinic of Kasr alainy hospitals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult female patients ASA I&II.
- age: 18-55 years old.
- BMI< 35.
- undergoing elective surgeries.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients with history of upper respiratory tract infections and obstructive sleep apnea.
- Patients who are potentially full stomach such as trauma, pregnancy, history of gastric regurgitation &heart burn, those with esophageal reflux or hiatus hernia.
- Patients with coagulation disorders.
- Patients with El-Ganzouri airway score â‰¥ 5 will.

facility.name: Department of anesthesia, Surgical ICU and Pain Management
